title: Error cannot relate bound region when passing reference of function (stable version of rust)

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: S-has-mcve
labels.description: A Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example has been found for this issue

body:
### Code The code can be found here https://github.com/JustFoxx/hexevent/blob/comtimeerror/src/lib.rs#L21 ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.68.0 (2c8cc3432 2023-03-06) binary: rustc commit-hash: 2c8cc343237b8f7d5a3c3703e3a87f2eb2c54a74 commit-date: 2023-03-06 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.68.0 LLVM version: 15.0.6 ``` ### Error output ``` error: internal compiler error: compiler/rustc_infer/src/infer/region_constraints/mod.rs:568:17: cannot relate bound region: ReLateBound(DebruijnIndex(0), BoundRegion { var: 0, kind: BrNamed(DefId(0:21 ~ hexevent[d727]::tests::invoker::'a), 'a) }) <= '_#9r ```
